result.execSummary:
The defendant Keri A. CAVANAUGH was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • UnconsentedPlacing/Prescription/PubPlace, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 450.15(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Under the Huber Law, commencing immediately.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody on probation hold.
The defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for one hundred twenty (120) days, under the Huber Law, commencing immediately.
Defendant has credit for 79 days.
Court costs are waived by the court.
Minutes.
